      • flushIfNeeded

        protected void flushIfNeeded(java.util.prefs.Preferences preferences)

      • getInputLocale

        public java.util.Locale getInputLocale(java.util.prefs.Preferences userPrefs)
        Description copied from interface: LocalizationInputProvider
        Get the editing/input locale. This locale is associated with data captured for the purpose of localization.

        Typically, the caller is a user, so the locales would be a per user setting in that case.

        Implementors should ensure that this never returns null, but instead returns a reasonable default if an edit locale hasn't been previously selected by the caller.
        Specified by:
        getInputLocale in interface LocalizationInputProvider
        Parameters:
        userPrefs - the user preferences.
        Returns:
        the edit locale.

      • getPreferenceNode

        protected java.util.prefs.Preferences getPreferenceNode(java.util.prefs.Preferences userPrefs,
                                            java.lang.String context)
        Get the preferences node.
        Parameters:
        userPrefs - the user preferences.
        context - context information for request. This may be null.
        Returns:
        the node.

      • getReferenceLocale

        public java.util.Locale getReferenceLocale(java.util.prefs.Preferences userPrefs)
        Description copied from interface: LocalizationInputProvider
        Get the reference locale. This locale is used to provide a reference/comparison for adhoc translation purposes.

        Typically, the caller is a user, so the locales would be a per user setting in that case.

        Specified by:
        getReferenceLocale in interface LocalizationInputProvider
        Parameters:
        userPrefs - the user preferences.
        Returns:
        the reference locale. May be null.

      • getTranslationLocales

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Locale> getTranslationLocales(java.util.prefs.Preferences userPrefs)
        Description copied from interface: LocalizationInputProvider
        Get the set of translation locales that are supported for the caller.

        Typically, the caller is a user, so the locales would be a per user setting in that case and would indicate that the locales are what the user knows how to translate.

        Specified by:
        getTranslationLocales in interface LocalizationInputProvider
        Parameters:
        userPrefs - the user preferences.
        Returns:
        the locales.

      • setInputLocale

        public void setInputLocale(java.util.prefs.Preferences userPrefs,
                  java.util.Locale locale)
        Description copied from interface: LocalizationInputProvider
        Set the editing/input locale.
        Specified by:
        setInputLocale in interface LocalizationInputProvider
        Parameters:
        userPrefs - the user preferences.
        locale - the locale. May be null - note that the corresponding getter doesn't return null.

        Set the translation locales.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        locales - the locales. Null should be treated as an empty set.
